t=
he name of a girl, if that's the case a fella called her name three times, =

dea=
th or something, "kleenix"=C2=A0"brush" or "hair broom!" The guy saying "ha=
ir broom" could

metimes,

rs.

    =
                  
                      Experiment 2

On Friday, 7/16/2010=
 I placed an 
                      object on top of my computer monitor, r=
ight in front of 
                      me, and will leave it there until n=
oon Denver time on 
                      Monday, 7/19/2010. This experimen=
t asks for participants 
                      to determine what that objec=
t is. Vague or partial answers 
                      won't be counted (for=
 example, just giving a color, shape, 
                      size, what it'=
s made of, etc): we're looking for what it 
                      is. Answe=
rs anyone reveals after noon Monday won't count. 
                      Par=
ticipants can use their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, or 
                   =
   any other means they chose. At the end of the experiment, 
             =
         I will reveal the object, and a tally of the number of 
          =
            correct and/or incorrect answers.

In order to keep 
          =
            me honest, I have taken a picture of the object at the 
       =
               start of the experiment and loaded it to the Files section 
=
                      (RJ folder) of this group. The idea with this file is=
 that 
                      you can download it now and 'keep it safe' on =
your 
                      computer. Then at the end of the experiment, I =
will post 
                      the password so you can reveal the content=
s of the file. 
                      That way, you were in control of the =
original image during 
                      the entire test, not me. If yo=
u can follow the link, it is 
                      here:

Windows users: h=
ttp://tech. groups.yahoo. 
                      com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ =
RJ/RJ20100716. 
                      win.zip

Mac users: http://tech. grou=
ps.yahoo. 
                      com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ20100716. 
=
                      mac.zip

And if you do not care to download the 
    =
                  zip file now, I will post the final image there at the en=
d 
                      of the experiment anyway.

My monitor is one of th=
e 
                      older box-like SONY CRTs, and says "Trinitron" and=
 
                      "Multiscan 200sf" on the upper front. I have a coup=
le 
                      monitors stacked in my closet too: they are not t=
he 
                      monitors used in this experiment (and have nothin=
g else on 
                      them anyway), and I have several laptops a=
round: they are 
                      also not the monitors in this experi=
ment. The monitor in 
                      this experiment is the only SON=
Y monitor I have, says 
                      "SONY in various places on it=
, can be seen in the 
                      following link from the first e=
xperiment, when the correct 
                      answer would have been "=
radio":

http://tech. groups.yahoo. 
                      com/group/ EVP-I=
TC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
                      1.JPG

Please post all ans=
wers to the group 
                      thread: that way, there will be a =
public record and I 
                      won't get accused of losing any =
answers. 

And best 
                      of luck to all the participants!=
